qas.question: What is Albert Einstein known for?

answers.text: his theories of special relativity and general relativity

qas.question: What did Einstein add to the Brownman Motion?
What did Einstein discover a resolution to?
What theory  did Einstein have reservations about?

context: Albert Einstein is known for <a0_0>his theories of special relativity and general relativity<a0_0/>. He also made important contributions to statistical mechanics, especially his <a1_0>mathematical treatment<a1_0/> of Brownian motion, his resolution of <a2_0>the paradox of specific heats<a2_0/>, and his connection of fluctuations and dissipation. Despite his reservations about its interpretation, Einstein also made contributions to quantum mechanics and, indirectly, <a3_0>quantum field theory<a3_0/>, primarily through his theoretical studies of the photon.
